abstract: ConocoPhillips and Occidental Petroleum, faced with plunging oil prices, post fourth-quarter 2014 losses; ConocoPhillips loses $39 million, compared with profit of $2.5 billion in year-ago quarter; Occidental loses $3.4 billion, compared with profit of $1.6 billion in year-ago quarter; losses come after years of record profits.
lead_paragraph: After years of the industry making record profits both companies said that they lost money in the fourth quarter.

byline.contributor: Clifford Krauss reported from Houston and Stanley Reed from London.
byline.original: By CLIFFORD KRAUSS and STANLEY REED

snippet: After years of the industry making record profits both companies said that they lost money in the fourth quarter.

headline.main: ConocoPhillips and Occidental Post Losses, Reflecting Oil Price Plunge
headline.print_headline: 2 Oil Giants Post Losses, Reflecting Price Plunge
